page.title: 19LANDSCAPE
page.content: The {townscape}of Whitchurch owes much of it's character to past history. The oldest part of the town lies along Bargates, High Street, Watergate Street and Dodington, marking the line of the Chester Roman road.The most famous landmark is{St. Alkmund's {Church}whose imposing sandstone tower dominates the town. Nearby Bargates is noted for the Elizabethan style grammar school and Georgian almshouses.The{High Street}is the town's finest.At the top a garage occupies a fine 15th century building whilst The Old Shop Nos. 21 and 23 are equally good examples of timber framing.For Georgian houses with delightful doorways St. Mary's Street is worth visiting and Dodington has much Late Georgian/ Early Victorian work.The Civic Centre and Tesco's are examples of{modern architecture. }
